result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. Henk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: NOTES - Sent Payment Plan via Mail

10:00 AM Defendant Eric L. Henk in court.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Eric L. Henk.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Agreement reached. State offers plea agreement on the record.  Attorney Lawton agrees. Court questions the defendant re: his plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. State moves to amend count 1 in 22CM8-striking the domestic enhancer. Granted. 


22CM08
Count 1-  Amended to a DC county Ordinance-Defendant pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 


22CM09
Count 1-DRI
Count 2-Defendant pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.

State makes sentencing argument. Argument from Atty Lawton. Defendant makes statement. Court sentences the defendant. 

22CM08-$114.50 60 DTP

22CM09-$579.00 60 DTP

Bond to be applied to court costs.
